VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_YUV444pl

int32_t VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_YUV444pl (const uint8_t *yc, uint32_t width, int32_t pitch, uint32_t height, uint8_t *restrict y, uint8_t *restrict cr, uint8_t *restrict cb)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_YUV444pl ( const uint8_t *  yc,
uint32_t  width,
int32_t  pitch,
uint32_t  height,
uint8_t *restrict  y,
uint8_t *restrict  cr,
uint8_t *restrict  cb 
)

Introduction and Use Cases:
YUV422 is a common imaging data format. If the YUV color channels are interleaved, as is often the case, this function is usually beneficial for improving the performance of vision applications, as it separates the three color channels into separate buffers, color planes. This is helpful because data transfers between external and internal memory are faster for contiguous data.
Description:
This function separates the three channels of an interleaved YUV422 data block into separate equal sized buffers. Currently, the algorithm does not decimate the luma component, butupsamples the chroma components by duplicating each chroma component.
Parameters:
[in] *yc Interleaved luma/chroma (UQ8.0)
[in] width Width of input image (number of luma pixels) (in pixels)
[in] pitch Pitch of input image (number of luma pixels) (in pixels)
[in] height Height of input image(number of luma pixels) (in pixels)
[out] *y Luma plane (8-bit) (in pixels)
[out] *cr Cr chroma plane (8-bit) (UQ8.0)
[out] *cb Cb chroma plane (8-bit) (UQ8.0)
Assumptions
  • All arrays should be 64-bit aligned.
  • width should be a multiple of 16, and greater than 0
  • width <= pitch
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
References:
  1. Digital Image Processing by R.C.Gonzales and R.E.Woods, Prentice-Hall, 2007
